cove noun [C]
(ON CEILING)
mainly UK (US usually cove molding) a long, curved piece of wood, plaster (= a smooth building material that becomes hard when it dries), etc. placed along the top edge of a wall where it joins the ceiling: Where a doorway extends to ceiling height, it may be necessary to interrupt the cove at either side. Frame-mounted art lights and cove lighting are examples of accent lighting. Synonyms
cove moulding
covingRelated word
coved
More examplesFewer examplesIf there isn't a cornice or cove, you can give the impression of one by painting a stripe immediately under the ceiling.Apply the adhesive to the two surfaces of the cove that will be in contact with the wall and ceiling, and push firmly and evenly into position.
